chunks.title: Form of Motions
chunks.content: Every motion must be accompanied by a proposed order. The proposed order shall be filed as a separate document and must contain the case number and the title of the motion to which it relates.

chunks.title: Memorandum of Points and Authorities
chunks.content: Each motion shall be accompanied by a memorandum of points and authorities in support thereof and by a statement of the specific points of law and the authorities upon which the movant relies.

chunks.title: Opposition Memorandum
chunks.content: Within 14 days of the date of service or at such other time as the Court may direct, an opposing party shall serve and file a memorandum of points and authorities in opposition to the motion. If such a memorandum is not filed within the prescribed time, the Court may treat the motion as conceded.

requirements.consequence_of_failure: motion may be treated as conceded

chunks.title: Reply Memorandum
chunks.content: Within 7 days after service of the memorandum in opposition, the moving party may serve and file a reply memorandum.

chunks.title: Oral Hearing
chunks.content: A party may request oral hearing on a motion by requesting a date from the courtroom deputy and noting the hearing date in the caption of the motion. In the absence of such a request, the Court, in its discretion, may decide the motion without oral argument.

requirements.default: Court may decide without oral argument

chunks.title: Motion for Summary Judgment
chunks.content: Each motion for summary judgment shall be accompanied by a statement of material facts as to which the moving party contends there is no genuine issue, which shall include references to the parts of the record relied on to support the statement. An opposition to such a motion shall be accompanied by a separate concise statement of genuine issues setting forth all material facts as to which it is contended there exists a genuine issue necessary to be litigated.

chunks.title: Page Limitations
chunks.content: Absent leave of the Court, memoranda of points and authorities in support of, and in opposition to, motions may not exceed 45 pages, and reply memoranda may not exceed 25 pages.

requirements.exception: leave of Court required to exceed

chunks.title: Leave to Exceed Page Limits
chunks.content: A motion for leave to file a memorandum in excess of the page limits must be filed before filing the memorandum and must include a proposed memorandum as an exhibit. The motion shall state the reasons why additional pages are necessary.

chunks.title: Formatting Requirements
chunks.content: Motions and submissions should be double-spaced, in 12-point Times New Roman font, with page numbers and margins of no less than 1 inch, and two spaces between sentences.

chunks.title: Citation Requirements
chunks.content: All citations must include exact page references (pin citations).

requirements.description: exact page references for all citations

examples.correct: Bell Atl. Corp. v. Twombly, 550 U.S. 544, 570 (2007)
examples.incorrect: Bell Atl. Corp. v. Twombly, 550 U.S. 544 (2007)

chunks.title: Electronic Filing Format
chunks.content: All electronically filed documents must be in text-searchable PDF format.
